topic.title: ODU_OHP Abstract

body.p: The 10GE ODU Overhead Processing block (ODU_OHP) coordinates extraction and insertion of overhead data between RX and TX Framers and an external overhead processor. The ODU_OHP contains four extraction and insertion processors, each of which may be configured to interface to ODU, FlexO or FlexE framers. FlexO and FlexE configurations support 6 channels. ODU configurations support either 190 or 6 channels. One of the extraction/insertion processor pairs can be switched between 2 framer interfaces. Overhead data is sent to and received from the external overhead processor in Ethernet packets over a 10GE interface. The ODU_OHP includes 10GE MAC and PCS functionality.

Each extraction processor receives overhead data from an RX Framer, builds Ethernet frames and sends them out to the external processing device. If interfacing to an ODU framer, it receives 16 Dwords of overhead data per ODU frame for each channel and selects any 10 of the Dwords based on a programmable Extraction Mask for each channel. Dwords are defined differently for ODU, FlexE and FlexO frames. If interfacing to a FlexO framer, the ODU_OHP receives 10 Dwords of overhead data per FlexO frame. If interfacing to a FlexE framer, the ODU_OHP receives five 66-bit codewords bits of overhead data per FlexE frame. When either 8 (in the case of ODU and FlexO) or 4 (in the case of FlexE) framesâ€™ worth of data is accumulated, a data packet is assembled for transmission to the external processor.
The ODU_OHP block is illustrated as the OH block in the device block diagram. The components of the ODU_OHP are now briefly described.

Each of the four Overhead Extraction blocks receives and buffers data from an RX Framer. For each channel, either 8 (in the case of ODU and FlexO) or 4 (in the case of FlexE) frames of overhead data are first buffered and then sent to the external processor over the 10GE Interface. Also, GCC data and SSF alarms may be extracted on a per channel basis and transmitted to GCC_TRANS_CN logic. Likewise, APS data may be extracted on a per channel basis and transmitted (with SSF) to external protection switching logic.

Each extraction block also interfaces with its corresponding insertion block in order to transmit data request packets to the external overhead processor for each channel on its behalf. The request packets are used to prefetch 8 (ODU and FlexO) or 4 (FlexE) frames of overhead data for any given channel.

Each of the four Overhead Insertion blocks serves a TX Framer. The block has two functions. First, to serve the data request for each channel from the TX Framer, when data is available. Second, to generate prefetch data requests for each channel using the MFAS value supplied by the TX Framer and applying an offset. Each block can also be programmed to fetch GCC Channel Data from GCC_TRANS logic and APS data from protection switching logic and to include such data in the insertion overhead sent to the requesting TX Framer.

The ODU_OHP has control logic to interface with the TX and RX engines of an integrated 10GE Ethernet MAC. This control logic implements the Ethernet frame assembly, Ethernet address filtering, packet transmit and receive to and from the 10GE Ethernet MAC.

The 10G Ethernet MAC block (XGE) consists of a transmit MAC, a receive MAC, a PCS layer, and packet status monitoring block. It handles the actual Ethernet frame TX and RX functions using the PCS layer. The 10G Ethernet MAC, in conjunction with the 10GE SERDES, supports a serial electrical interface.
